snippet: One of the biggest suppliers for Apple, Dell, Hewlett-Packard and other electronics companies said salaries for many workers would immediately jump by 16 to 25 percent.
abstract: Foxconn Technology, one of the biggest manufacturers of products for Apple, Dell, Hewlett-Packard and other electronics companies, says that it will sharply raise worker salaries at its Chinese factories.

headline.main: Foxconn Plans to Lift Pay Sharply at Factories in China
headline.print_headline: Foxconn Plans To Sharply Lift Workers’ Pay

snippet: A number of apps will help keep smartphone owners from losing their phones, or the digital secrets they have stored on them.
abstract: App City column notes several security applications for smartphones.

snippet: The low-cost labor that has made China’s factories nearly unbeatable is not so cheap anymore.
Well-off Brazilians are flocking to New York, where they are snapping up expensive apartments. And in Miami, they are propping up a moribund market.
abstract: Big Deal column; well-off Brazilians are flocking to New York City, where they are quietly becoming steady clients for higher-end real estate brokers in Manhattan.

abstract: Eric Hansen travel article on a deep-winter, cross-country ski tour through the forests of Maine. Maps, Photos (L)9

snippet: 8:48 p.m. | Updated      Federal authorities on Friday charged one of the most vocal and vehement critics of their campaign to root out insider trading on Wall Street, accusing John Kinnucan, an Oregon-based research analyst, of swapping corporate...
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation charges research analyst John Kinnucan of swapping corporate secrets with hedge funds for cash; he was one of the most vocal and vehement critics of their campaign to root out insider trading on Wall Street. Photos (M)/

headline.main: A Research Analyst Is Accused of Insider Trading

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and BEN PROTESS
